SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.tasksDatabase

Class TasksDatabaseUI

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.tasksDatabase.TasksDatabaseManager
com.floweektracker.tasksDatabase.TasksDatabaseUI
public class TasksDatabaseUI extends TasksDatabaseManager
Represents the UI of the task names database allowing users to add and remove task names in a database. This class extends from the TasksDatabaseManager class to leverage database management functionality.

Fields:
  • taskDatabaseDialog - a JDialog representing the dialog allowing the user to add or remove a task name in the database, displayed to the user
  • taskInputField - a JTextField allowing the user to enter the task name which can be add or remove from the database
  • buttons - an array of JButtons representing adding, removing, and cancelling buttons /li>
  • tasksList - a JList reference containing Strings representing the existing list of task names
Dialog creating methods:
  • setupTaskDialog() - configures taskDatabaseDialog by adding dedicated components and settings
Left panel creating methods:
  • createLeftPanel() - creates JPanel for taskDatabaseDialog containing tasksList
Right panel creating methods:
  • createRightPanel() - creates a JPanel for taskDatabaseDialog containing taskInputField and buttons
  • createTaskAddingPanel() - creates a JPanel containing taskInputField, used in the createRightPanel() method
  • createButtonsPanel() - creates a JPanel containing buttons, used in the createRightPanel() method

  • Field Details

    • taskDatabaseDialog

      private final JDialog taskDatabaseDialog
      Contains a JDialog instance representing the UI dialog allowing the user to add or remove a task name in the database. It is displayed to the user to manage task names.
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseUI()
      • setupTaskDialog()

    • taskInputField

      private final JTextField taskInputField
      Contains a JTextField instance allowing the user to enter the task name which can be added or removed in the database. It is used in the UI to provide functionality for managing task names.
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseUI()
      • createTaskAddingPanel()
      • getTaskInputField()

    • buttons

      private final JButton[] buttons
      Contains an array of the JButtons representing the buttons for adding, removing, and cancelling tasks. This array is used in the UI to provide functionality for managing task names.
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseUI()
      • createButtonsPanel()
      • getButtons()

    • tasksList

      private final JList<String> tasksList
      Contains a JList instance with Strings representing the existing task names. It is used in the UI to display and manage the list of task names.
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseUI()
      • createLeftPanel()
      • TasksDatabaseManager.getTasksList()

  • Constructor Details

    • TasksDatabaseUI

      public TasksDatabaseUI()
      Constructs a new TasksDatabaseUI instance. This constructor initializes references to the taskDatabaseDialog, taskInputField, buttons, and tasksList. Finally, it invokes the setupTaskDialog() method to add components and setting to the taskDatabaseDialog.
      See Also:
      • MainListeners.createButtonsListener()

  • Method Details

    • setupTaskDialog

      private void setupTaskDialog()
      Adds components and settings to the taskDatabaseDialog. Sets the layout, size, title, and modality. Then, it adds rigid areas and JPanels from the createLeftPanel() and createRightPanel(). Next, it creates new TasksDatabaseListeners to add listeners to the components. Finally, it invokes the pack() method to resize the window, center it and set its visibility.
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseUI()

    • createLeftPanel

      private JPanel createLeftPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing a JLabel informing the user about the list content, and a JScrollPane with the tasksList, providing a scrollable view of the task names.
      Returns:
      a JPanel representing the left part of the taskDatabaseDialog
      See Also:
      • setupTaskDialog()

    • createRightPanel

      private JPanel createRightPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing panels from the createTaskAddingPanel() and createButtonsPanel(), and vertical space at the top and bottom for visual separation.
      Returns:
      a JPanel representing the right part of the taskDatabaseDialog
      See Also:
      • setupTaskDialog()

    • createTaskAddingPanel

      private JPanel createTaskAddingPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing:
      • a JLabel informing the user about the taskInputField content
      • the taskInputField to allow user input
      Returns:
      a JPanel representing the top part of the panel from the createRightPanel()

    • createButtonsPanel

      private JPanel createButtonsPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing buttons.
      Returns:
      a JPanel containing the buttons defined in buttons.

    • getTaskInputField

      JTextField getTaskInputField()
      Returns:
      the JTextField used for task input

    • getButtons

      JButton[] getButtons()
      Returns:
      the array of JButton objects representing the buttons

    • getTasksJList

      JList<String> getTasksJList()
      Returns:
      the JList of String representing the task names list
